alert.note: Alert for Louisa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 4:31AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington affecting all of the counties bordering the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at New Boston LD17. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.6 feet, The Lake Odessa levee overtops. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:40 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to 19.4 feet Thursday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. Safety information is available at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. The next statement will be issued late this morning.
